subject: Use the same rpmbuild macro name for enabling Murphy ASM support everywhere.
commitMessage:
Use the same rpmbuild macro name for enabling Murphy ASM support
everywhere.

This allows using global flags to enable or disable Murphy ASM
support in several components at the same time. Also bump the
version number and update changelog.

Murphy support is now compiled in using the following command:

> gbs build --define 'with_audio_session_manager_with_murphy 1'

Change-Id: I35654b860151c16979774cf8bb86e1872b605d47

subject: Added changelog and packaging.
commitMessage:
Added changelog and packaging.

If you want to compile with Murphy support, you need to define
"enable_murphy" from gbs or rpmbuild command line. For example
this works:

> gbs build --define 'enable_murphy 1'

subject: Make ASM handling external.
commitMessage: Make ASM handling external.

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        succeeded      

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       armv7l         unresolvable   

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

I would be especially interested in code review done by Samsung engineers. The patch conditionally removes ASM support from sound server. The idea is that we can then decide with a simple compile flag whether or not we use Murphy as policy backend (as is done in IVI vertical) or let sound-server take care of that (as is done in mobile vertical).
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
